title: Death's Coffer

properties.name: description
properties.value: Death's Coffer is a chest located in a corner of Death's Office. Players are able to sacrifice items worth 10,000 or more, individually, in return for 105% of their Grand Exchange price. The profits can only be used to pay for item reclamation fees as well as creating private instances of boss rooms; the sacrificed items cannot be returned. This offers a faster and more economic way of obtaining money for this purpose than manually selling items on the Exchange. It also offers an opportunity to get rid of items that have a listed price much higher than their actual selling price (items that are "crashing") while also providing an additional 5% profit.

content:
Death's Coffer
Released25 June 2020 (Update)
MembersNo
QuestNo
LocationDeath's Office
OptionsSacrifice
ExamineSacrifice items to pay down item reclamation fees.
Map
Advanced data
Object ID39550

Death's Coffer is a chest located in a corner of Death's Office. Players are able to sacrifice items worth 10,000 or more, individually, in return for 105% of their Grand Exchange price. The profits can only be used to pay for item reclamation fees as well as creating private instances of boss rooms; the sacrificed items cannot be returned. This offers a faster and more economic way of obtaining money for this purpose than manually selling items on the Exchange. It also offers an opportunity to get rid of items that have a listed price much higher than their actual selling price (items that are "crashing") while also providing an additional 5% profit.

Sacrifice items to Death's Coffer

Players can sacrifice up to a value of 2,147,483,647 coins. If players attempt to sacrifice items that will exceed the coffer's limit, a message in the game chatbox will state "The coffer is too full to accommodate that."

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • A coffer is a storage chest. However, the plural coffers is used when talking about a treasury or funds.
  • A dragon hunter crossbow, dragon full helm, Bandos chestplate, and dragon scimitar can be seen inside the chest, making the value of its contents around 174,821,228 if you ignore the loose coins, platinum tokens, and bones.

'''Death's Coffer''' is a chest located in a corner of [[Death's Office]]. Players are able to sacrifice items worth {{Coins|10000}} or more, individually, in return for 105% of their [[Grand Exchange]] price. The profits can '''only''' be used to pay for item reclamation fees as well as creating private instances of boss rooms; the sacrificed items cannot be returned. This offers a faster and more economic way of obtaining money for this purpose than manually selling items on the Exchange. It also offers an opportunity to get rid of items that have a listed price much higher than their actual selling price (items that are "crashing") while also providing an additional 5% profit. 
[[File:Death's Coffer interface.png|thumb|left|Sacrifice items to Death's Coffer]]
Players can sacrifice up to a value of 2,147,483,647 coins. If players attempt to sacrifice items that will exceed the coffer's limit, a message in the game chatbox will state "''The coffer is too full to accommodate that.''"

==Trivia==
*A coffer is a storage chest. However, the plural coffers is used when talking about a treasury or funds.
*A [[dragon hunter crossbow]], [[dragon full helm]], [[Bandos chestplate]], and [[dragon scimitar]] can be seen inside the chest, making the value of its contents around {{Coins|({{GEP|dragon hunter crossbow}} + {{GEP|dragon full helm}} + {{GEP|Bandos chestplate}} + {{GEP|dragon scimitar}})}} if you ignore the loose coins, platinum tokens, and bones.
